document.heading: Public Property Lead Elimination Act of 1977

history.narrative: Law 2-28, the “Public Property Lead Elimination Act of 1977,” was introduced in Council and assigned Bill No. 2-85, which was referred to the Committee on Government Operations. The Bill was adopted on first and second readings on June 28, 1977 and July 12, 1977, respectively. Signed by the Mayor on August 1, 1977, it was assigned Act No. 2-63 and transmitted to both Houses of Congress for its review.
